CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The onset of oxidation potentials ( E ox ) of PIDT - EHNT , PIDT - DTNT and PIDT-C12NT referred to ferrocene / ferrocenium ( Fc / Fc + ) were 0.68 , 0.68 , and 0.72 V , respectively with the corresponding calculated HOMO energy levels of -5.48 , -5.48 , and -5.52 eV according to the equation of HOMO = -e(E ox + 4.80 ) ( eV ). The LUMO energy levels were calculated from the difference of the HOMO energy levels and optical band gaps according to the equation : LUMO = ( HOMO + E opt g ) eV , which lies in the range of -3.79 ∼ -3.88 eV. The electrochemical data are summarized in Table 1. All polymers showed very deep HOMO levels of ca. -5.5 eV , which were much lower than the reported benzodithiophene-NT ( PBDT - DTNT ) based poly- mers , 20 illustrating that IDT was a good donor unit that can offer deep HOMO level and high V oc of the PSCs based on the target polymers can be anticipated. Mobility. Hole mobility of donor polymers played an important role in the OPV performance of the resulting PSCs. 53 In order to evaluate the hole mobility of the resulting polymers , corresponding hole - only devices with configuration o f I T O / p o l y ( 3 , 4 -e t h y l e n e d i o x y t h i o p h e n e ) : p o l y -(styrenesulfonate) ( PEDOT : PSS ) / polymer / MoO 3 / Al were fabricated and the hole mobilities were obtained by using the space charge limited current ( SCLC ) model. The calculated hole mobilities of PIDT - EHNT , PIDT - DTNT , and PIDT-C12NT were 9.84 × 10^-5 , 1.66 × 10^-4 , and 2.42 × 10^-4 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 , respectively. When considering that PIDT-C12NT shows higher hole mobility and superior absorption to that of PIDT - EHNT and PIDT - DTNT , it is rational to envisage that PIDT-C12NT would achieve superior processability and backbone planarity among three polymers. Morphology. Insight into the nanoscale surface topography of the polymer : PC71BM blend films with weight ratio of 1 : 2 were carried out by tapping mode atomic force microscopy ( AFM ). As can be seen in Figure 5 , blend films based on PIDT - EHNT and PIDT - DTNT with PC71BM showed unexpected phase separation , with corresponding domain size over 200 and 100 nm , respectively which are much larger than typical exciton diffusion length of ca. 10 nm. 54,55 In contrast , PIDT-C12NT based blend film displayed an interpenetrating bicontinuous network between polymer and PC71BM with optimal domain size of 10-20 nm that is pretty favorable for efficient diffusion of excitons to donor - acceptor interface.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's identify the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph:

1. PIDT - EHNT: This is a material name, as it is a specific type of polymer.
2. PIDT - DTNT: This is also a material name, as it is a different type of polymer.
3. PIDT-C12NT: This is a material name, as it is a specific type of polymer.
4. PC71BM: This is a material name, as it is a specific type of material (in this case, a blend of polymer and a molecule).

So, there are three material names in the paragraph: PIDT - EHNT, PIDT - DTNT, and PC71BM.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Of course! Here are the material names mentioned in the paragraph:

1. PIDT - EHNT
2. PIDT - DTNT
3. PC71BM

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the material names mentioned in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PIDT - EHNT |
| PIDT - DTNT |
| PC71BM |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

PN.content:
Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The onset of oxidation potentials ( E ox ) of PIDT - EHNT , PIDT - DTNT and PIDT-C12NT referred to ferrocene / ferrocenium ( Fc / Fc + ) were 0.68 , 0.68 , and 0.72 V , respectively with the corresponding calculated HOMO energy levels of -5.48 , -5.48 , and -5.52 eV according to the equation of HOMO = -e(E ox + 4.80 ) ( eV ). The LUMO energy levels were calculated from the difference of the HOMO energy levels and optical band gaps according to the equation : LUMO = ( HOMO + E opt g ) eV , which lies in the range of -3.79 ∼ -3.88 eV. The electrochemical data are summarized in Table 1. All polymers showed very deep HOMO levels of ca. -5.5 eV , which were much lower than the reported benzodithiophene-NT ( PBDT - DTNT ) based poly- mers , 20 illustrating that IDT was a good donor unit that can offer deep HOMO level and high V oc of the PSCs based on the target polymers can be anticipated. Mobility. Hole mobility of donor polymers played an important role in the OPV performance of the resulting PSCs. 53 In order to evaluate the hole mobility of the resulting polymers , corresponding hole - only devices with configuration o f I T O / p o l y ( 3 , 4 -e t h y l e n e d i o x y t h i o p h e n e ) : p o l y -(styrenesulfonate) ( PEDOT : PSS ) / polymer / MoO 3 / Al were fabricated and the hole mobilities were obtained by using the space charge limited current ( SCLC ) model. The calculated hole mobilities of PIDT - EHNT , PIDT - DTNT , and PIDT-C12NT were 9.84 × 10^-5 , 1.66 × 10^-4 , and 2.42 × 10^-4 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 , respectively. When considering that PIDT-C12NT shows higher hole mobility and superior absorption to that of PIDT - EHNT and PIDT - DTNT , it is rational to envisage that PIDT-C12NT would achieve superior processability and backbone planarity among three polymers. Morphology. Insight into the nanoscale surface topography of the polymer : PC71BM blend films with weight ratio of 1 : 2 were carried out by tapping mode atomic force microscopy ( AFM ). As can be seen in Figure 5 , blend films based on PIDT - EHNT and PIDT - DTNT with PC71BM showed unexpected phase separation , with corresponding domain size over 200 and 100 nm , respectively which are much larger than typical exciton diffusion length of ca. 10 nm. 54,55 In contrast , PIDT-C12NT based blend film displayed an interpenetrating bicontinuous network between polymer and PC71BM with optimal domain size of 10-20 nm that is pretty favorable for efficient diffusion of excitons to donor - acceptor interface.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's identify the property names of materials mentioned in the paragraph:

1. PIDT: This is the name of the donor material.
2. EHNT: This is the name of the acceptor material.
3. DTNT: This is the name of the acceptor material.
4. C12NT: This is the name of the acceptor material.
5. Fc / Fc +: This is the name of the ferrocene/ferrocenium complex.
6. HOMO: This is the name of the highest occupied molecular orbital energy level.
7. LUMO: This is the name of the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital energy level.
8. E opt g: This is the name of the optical band gap energy level.
9. PBDT: This is the name of the benzodithiophene-based polymer.
10. PSS: This is the name of the polystyrene sulfonate material.
11. MoO3: This is the name of the molybdenum oxide material.
12. Al: This is the name of the aluminum material.
13. PC71BM: This is the name of the PC71BM material.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material.

Of course! Here are the entities that refer to the property name of a material in the provided text:

1. PIDT
2. EHNT
3. DTNT
4. C12NT

These are the only entities in the text that refer directly to the property name of a material.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph that refer to the property name of a material, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Property Name":

| --- |

Sure! Let's identify the values of material properties mentioned in the paragraph:

1. Onset of oxidation potentials (Eox):
 * PIDT-EHNT: 0.68 V
 * PIDT-DTNT: 0.68 V
 * PIDT-C12NT: 0.72 V
2. Calculated HOMO energy levels:
 * PIDT-EHNT: -5.48 eV
 * PIDT-DTNT: -5.48 eV
 * PIDT-C12NT: -5.52 eV
3. LUMO energy levels:
 * Calculated from HOMO energy levels and optical band gaps: -3.79 eV to -3.88 eV
4. Hole mobility:
 * PIDT-EHNT: 9.84 x 10^-5 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1
 * PIDT-DTNT: 1.66 x 10^-4 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1
 * PIDT-C12NT: 2.42 x 10^-4 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1
5. Morphology:
 * Domain size of blend films based on PIDT-EHNT and PIDT-DTNT with PC71BM: over 200 nm and 100 nm, respectively
 * Domain size of PIDT-C12NT based blend film: 10-20 nm

Note that some of these values are mentioned in the paragraph, while others are calculated or inferred from the given information.
